thread.title: Montenegro: Vladimir Putin's pawn in Russia's unrelenting hostility to the West - Telegraph.co.uk
thread.title_full: Montenegro: Vladimir Putin's pawn in Russia's unrelenting hostility to the West - Telegraph.co.uk

title: Montenegro: Vladimir Putin's pawn in Russia's unrelenting hostility to the West - Telegraph.co.uk
text:
18 February 2017 • 9:00pm Russian President Vladimir Putin Credit: Reuters 
W ith an overall population no bigger than that of a medium-sized European city and occupying just a sliver of national territory, Montenegro should be of little interest to a power such as Russia. 
But the tiny Balkan state which disappeared from the maps in 1918 and only narrowly voted to regain its independence in 2006 has now reverted to a role for which it was famous throughout the 19 th century: that of a pawn, used by Russia in its broader strategic confrontation with the West. 
For over a decade, Russian oligarchs have parked their ill-gotten cash and peroxide blonde girlfriends in Montenegro, attracted by the country’s scenic beauty and stunning coastline, lavish casinos with plenty of money-laundering opportunities and the absence of any currency risk: Montenegro uses the Euro as its legal tender. The Montenegin town of Ulcin Credit: AFP 
B ut behind these transactions lurked a bigger strategic objective: that of using Montenegro... Premium Subscribe now for full access or register to continue reading Subscribe now for full access or register to continue Register / free One Premium article per week Newsletters and daily briefings
